item.title: Resolving the paradox of the Dirac equation: phenomenology
item.description: arXiv:2404.08009v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Based on the results of F. Wilf on the need to take into account the quantum-mechanical correspondence rules in the Dirac equation for an electron, it was shown that the equation obtained by giving physical meaning to $\alpha$-Dirac operators should be considered as a phenomenological equation for a particle of non-zero size - the EM polaron, previously introduced by the author. This allows a solution to be found to the inherent paradox of the Dirac equation, which consists of the equality of the velocity of the moving particles to the speed of light $c$ in a vacuum, which is a priori unobtainable, and to understand the physical essence of spin as the intrinsic mechanical moment of an EM polaron. It is also shown that the Dirac-Wilf equation for a single spatial dimension can be considered a generalization of the Schrodinger equation for relativistic energies.
item.dc:creator: Serge F. Timashev

item.title: Unification of the Gauge Theories
item.description: arXiv:2404.18937v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We treat the Christoffel coeffcients as operators and introduce new mappings for quaternionic products to connect with the theory of electrodynamics in general spacetime. By utilizing the directional operator of the covariant derivative, we generalize the quaternionic mechanism to the theory of electrodynamics. We demonstrate that the Einstein equation allows selecting a constant term that aligns with the covariant derivative.
